Keyword.name: it
Keyword.Description: `it` is a context keyword that allows a string expression to reference the current data element being referenced.
Keyword.Remarks:
You can use the equivalent symbol `$` instead of `it`.
All context keywords (`it`, `parent`, and `root`) can be disabled by setting `GlobalConfig`.[`AreContextKeywordsEnabled`][0] to `false`.

Keyword.name: parent
Keyword.Description: `parent` is a context keyword that allows a string expression to reference the parent of the current data element being referenced.
Keyword.Remarks:
You can use the equivalent symbol `^` instead of `parent`.
All context keywords (`it`, `parent`, and `root`) can be disabled by setting `GlobalConfig`.[`AreContextKeywordsEnabled`][0] to `false`.
[0]: /Library/GlobalConfig/Property-AreContextKeywordsEnabled

Keyword.name: root
Keyword.Description: `root` is a context keyword that allows a string expression to reference the root data element.
Keyword.Remarks:
You can use the equivalent symbol `~` instead of `root`.
All context keywords (`it`, `parent`, and `root`) can be disabled by setting `GlobalConfig`.[`AreContextKeywordsEnabled`][0] to `false`.

Keyword.name: iif
Keyword.Description: `iif` is used to create an inline if statement.

Example.HeaderRemarks: The following example how to use the `iif` keyword.
Example.ExampleCode:
var baseQuery = new int[] { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 }.AsQueryable();
var result = baseQuery.Select("iif(it % 2 = 0, true, false)");
Example.EquivalentCode:
var baseQuery = new int[] { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 }.AsQueryable();
var result = baseQuery.Select(x => x % 2 == 0 ? true : false);
